alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Dubuque; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jackson, Cedar, northwestern Scott, southwestern Dubuque, northeastern Johnson, Jones, north central Muscatine, southeastern Linn and western Clinton Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rochester, or near Tipton, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tipton around 220 AM CDT. Stanwood around 230 AM CDT. Lowden around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oxford Junction, Wyoming, Lost Nation, Onslow, Monmouth, Nashville, Canton, Hurstville and Fulton. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 255 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Dubuque; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Scott
